meanings.definition: The practice of behaving obsequiously to gain favor or advantage.
meanings.sent1: His toadyism towards the boss was obvious to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: She was tired of the toadyism displayed by her colleagues just to get ahead.
meanings.sent3: The toadyism of the new intern was both amusing and annoying at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The toadyism in the corporate world can sometimes be likened to a game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The toadyism of the politician was so extreme that it became a running joke among voters.
